content.question: The rate at which a baby bird gains weight is proportional to the difference between its adult weight and its current weight. At time t = 0, when the bird is first weighed, its weight is 20 grams. If B(t) is the weight of the bird, in grams, at time t days after it is first weighed, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>5</mn> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>100</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@424D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = B(t) be the solution to the differential equation above with initial condition B(0) = 20. (a) Is the bird gaining weight faster when it weighs 40 grams or when it weighs 70 grams? Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: The rate at which a baby bird gains weight is proportional to the difference between its adult weight and its current weight. At time t = 0, when the bird is first weighed, its weight is 20 grams. If B(t) is the weight of the bird, in grams, at time t days after it is first weighed, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>5</mn> </mfrac> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>100</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@424D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = B(t) be the solution to the differential equation above with initial condition B(0) = 20. (a) Is the bird gaining weight faster when it weighs 40 grams or when it weighs 70 grams? Explain your reasoning.

(b) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of B. Use <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>B</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to explain why the graph of B cannot resemble the following graph.
(c) Use separation of variables to find y = B(t), the particular solution to the differential equation with initial condition B(0) = 20.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
